page.title: 01General
page.content: The region is a rural area in N. Notts., lying in the Trent Valley. The area includes the villages of {Weston, Grassthorpe,}the southern part of{Normanton-on-Trent}and the northern end of{Sutton-on-Trent.}The A1 and the mainline railway run almost parallel SE/NW across the region. Three lines of pylons cross the area to converge at the power station north of Normanton. The villages are peaceful, quiet places, with few buildings, mostly residential, and of various ages, some renovated. A circular bus service passes through twice daily, en route to towns outside the area. Generally the region is flat, and the villages are surrounded by farmlands, separated by hedges, and used for mixed farming.There are no schools in the survey area boundaries, though Normanton and Sutton have Primaries.
